quotes.quote: Some people become fully discouraged in life because of their series of mistakes and failures; while others succeed by consistently learning from theirs.
It is discouraging how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
Disappointment focuses on â€˜what is not,' and completely misses the far greater reality of â€˜what now is.
Discouragement is root of distress.
Lose of hope leads to discouragement.
Discouragement is the cancer of great things.
If you're trying to invent something new, you're going to reach a lot of discouraging points, and most people give up.
Never discourage anyone who continually makes progress, no matter how slow even if that someone is yourself!
Many discouraging hours will arise before the rainbow of accomplished goals will appear on the horizon.
Discouragement comes when things are going great, and it comes when we are already down, but no matter when it comes, it hurts.

To be discouraged is to view that which is current as a condition that will always be. The process of turning discouragement into renewal and a vision of accomplishment is to utilize aspects of what didn't yield results into a refined attempt to begin afresh. It is not the world's problem that discouragement is experienced; it is more that one chooses to allow circumstances to dictate one's future.
Do not be discouraged if your plans do not succeed the first time. No one learns to walk by taking only one step.
A discouring teacher is more dangerous than a brainless ignorant.
No matter how discouraged we get, God has not asked us to do the impossible.

Don't be discouraged by a failure. It can be a positive experience. Failure is, in a sense, the highway to success, inasmuch as every discovery of what is false leads us to seek earnestly after what is true, and every fresh experience points out some.
Being discouraged is natural but giving up is not an option.
Don't be discouraged if the answer to your prayer does not come immediately. Study, ponder, and pray, sincerely having faith, and live the commandments.
Within the soil of a discouraging season can often be the seeds of incredible blessing, miracles and breakthrough!
Don't get discouraged from all the rejection.
Many feel discouraged because they have not measured up to their potential.
It's discouraging to make a mistake, but it's humiliating when you find out you're so unimportant that nobody noticed it.
Nothing is more discouraging than unappreciated sarcasm.
A man can get discouraged many times but he is not a failure until he begins to blame somebody else and stops trying.
Don't be discouraged. It's often the last key in the bunch that opens the lock.
Don't be discouraged by your incapacity to dispel darkness from the world. Light your little candle and step forward.
Seeds of discouragement will not grow in the thankful heart.
For every discouragement has been allowed to come to us in order that through it we may be cast in utter helplessness at the Saviour's feet.
Discouragement is simply the despair of wounded self-love.
Discouragement seizes us only when we can no longer count on chance.
Discouragement is contagious and is easily transmitted to others.
Discouragement often is a result of listening to people who have their own best interests planned for your life.
Discouragement itself is a form of pride.
Discouragement is not the absence of adequacy but the absence of courage.
Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
